title.narrative: Supporting animal production and cultivation of grains in Al-Farqalas

description.narrative:
The conflict in Syria had a catastrophic effect on the country's economy. The country witnessed market collapse, inflation, devaluation, looting and destruction, in addition to exposure to severe damage in all social, economic, health and professional fields, especially the agriculture and animal husbandry sector, and as a result of the armed conflict and war, many agricultural lands and livestock were damaged as a result of land fires agricultural and crops, the death of livestock, the absence of veterinary and agricultural health care crews, the destruction of irrigation networks, the lack of financial resources for the population, and the depletion of capital as a result of the war that lasted for several years. This led to the presence of approximately 6.5 million people suffering from food insecurity 2.5 million others who are at risk of food insecurity and this led to major economic crises and damage in an important sector of the Syrian economy which is agriculture, where it depends on the Syrian economy by 30% and led to the existence of A large number of poor workers and high unemployment rates in the population, as reported in HNO 2019. In a context more related to Homs governorate, the governorate has been significantly affected during the last period, and with poor security conditions and limited access to resources, livelihoods have been significantly affected and its productivity has decreased, in parallel with increased significantly in prices of food and the daily essential needs, which has led to major problems In food insecurity, malnutrition and poverty. In addition to the migration of men and young men or joining compulsory service, a large number of families headed by women have emerged, forcing them to work in harsh conditions and expose them to abuse in some cases. In the context of the efforts that been made by Al Birr Association to improve the economic situation of the population, and help them obtain income-generating sources.
Based on these data, and the studied needs of the region through in-depth interviews with key people in those areas such as the village head as well as the information obtained from the association’s branch in Al-Farqalas.
the response of Al-Birr is based on supporting the food security and agricultural in Al-Farqalas through provide the livestock and agricultural grants that suit the nature of the region and the population, by two kinds of grants one of them depends on provide grants related to livestock to produce meat and milk by providing two sheep with its fodder for 6 months, utensils for animal feed, and periodic visits by veterinarians to supervise sheep health and treat them if needed.
The other grant will be agricultural grants to support the agricultural production by tilling the farmlands of beneficiaries and providing one-ton barley for the cultivation of 100 donum, while Al-Birr will monitor the project activities by two MampE staff to ensure that the project is on the right track and it is achieving its goals according to the specified indicators.
